p: In fact, our tested R. chalepensis essential oil from Jerusalem, Hebron, and Jenin regions had IC 50 = 6.9 ± 0.94 μg/ml, 7.8 ± 1.05 μg/ml, and 19.9 ± 0.68 μg/ml, respectively, that showed that our studied essential oils had more powerful antioxidant activity than the above-mentioned study on the antioxidant potential for R. chalepensis leaves extract [ 62]. This may be justified due to differences in the location, weather, soils, method of preparation, and type of tested extracts.
